intro: Stylocoryna pandaki, commonly known as the Pandaki's stylocoryna, is a flowering plant native to specific regions of Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae, which includes many shrubs and climbers. The plant is characterized by its simple, opposite leaves and small, clustered flowers with four petals. It typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as forest understories. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and potentially endangered species.
